alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 4:18PM MDT until June 15 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the area. However, more rain is expected to move back into the area after 445 pm. So far there have been no reports of flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas, including Big Sandy Creek. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hugo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
